page.title: 07CUSTOMS
page.content: Traditions of straw plaiting for Luton hats has gone with the visiting fish- monger, the local baker who cooked the villagers' pies in his cooling oven and the liver dumplings one end with jam the other for the field workers. There is still an annual Fete on the green, a huge bonfire and fireworks on Nov.5th near the well, a Christmas Bazaar and a senior citizens Christmas dinner with entertainments. Supposed- ly an escape route from Berkhamsted Castle comes to Grove Farm. There are sandstone caves under the green. One called Cathedral Cave has a deep swift under-ground river. Cave climbers are searching for the entrance which was blocked for safety. It is hoped the caves will prove a safe place for people in a nuclear war.Springs rise every 7 years. They flooded in 1914 & 1939.
